Comments_List: Did a lot of the same electro- and magneto-statics that we've been doing for a while in physics as well as a lot of conductors, capacitors, inductors, transmission wires, and antennas.
The demos in class are nice, but not helpful and seemed to waste time because they treat things very simply and not at the complex level at which a 300-level course requires.
Take Physics 430. It will be rigorous.

If you are comfortable with an introductory E&M physics sequence, you will be prepared for this course. The applications of E&M were interesting, and if an individual wants to see that side of second semester physics and isn't afraid of work, then I would suggest a student take this course.
No! Do NOT take this class!
